name: Giant Fire Beetle
description: A Giant Fire Beetle is a small, insect-like creature that emits a faint glow from glands near its head, often found in dark caves and forests.
memorable: Unique ability to provide illumination in dark environments.
goals: To feed on plants or small creatures and defend itself if provoked.
relations: Often found in the company of other insects; may be encountered with miners or adventurers.
environment: Commonly found underground and in dark forests.
strengths: Emits light that aids vision in darkness; can be captured for use as a light source.
weaknesses: Low hit points and poor combat ability make it vulnerable.
attacks: Can make a Bite attack dealing minimal slashing damage.
most_powerful_ability: Fire Glands allow it to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius for navigation.
senses: Possesses blindsight up to 30 feet, allowing it to detect creatures and objects without relying on vision.
additional_information: Bioluminescent glow aids in navigation for adventurers.
Glands continue to emit light for 1d6 days after the beetle dies.
Regarded as harmless and often non-aggressive.
A favored creature for those exploring dark environments.
Has very low intelligence and awareness.
